intro: Iguanura geonomiformis var. malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca evergreen, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
